author: sky.cactus
content: Net metering is the solution to this, with the exception of it still requires a storage load.  A purely in-memory version could make it so even the SLOAD wasn't required.  I am not aware of any *active* efforts to push an EIP like this through.

author: sky.cactus
content: There is also so theoretic minor value in per-block transient storage, which also would not need to go to disk.

content:
Could there be any benefit to changing the fee schedule for logs?

Currently costs are:
```Glog: 375 Partial payment for a LOG operation.
Glogdata: 8 Paid for each byte in a LOG operationâ€™s data.
Glogtopic: 375 Paid for each topic of a LOG operation.```

author: 3xmd1559sporebraytondingo
content:
Has anyone explored increasing the cost of Glog and decreasing the cost of Glogtopic? For example:
```Glog: 1000
Glogtopic: 200```

author: _shemnon
content: All topics are searchable by index, so there should be _some_ premium over the cost of raw data, and they implicitly fill all 32 bytes, even if it is with zero.  They also are added to the bloom filter.  200 makes log topics cheaper than a similar amount of data (256gas), which means more work for less gas paid.  As it stands we are only charging 46% more for handling the data at least twice to three times as much.

author: _shemnon
content: Any analysis based on client handling and long term value would likely result in an increase relative to per-byte data.
